Posts.Content: May 16, 2013 03:59PM themodeldoctor wrote: Hi, Today, I just found out that the cancer that was just in my bones is now in my liver and lungs. My doctor switched me to Xeloda today. Other than being devastated about the results, I learned that my co-pay is $75. Because of my bone pain, I only work part-time. I would gladly pay for someone to ship me an unused pills. I am so pissed right. I had cancer as a child. I am only 42 and will probably never get married or be happy again. My body has been mutilated. The top of my hair still hasn't grown back from Tamoxifen. I just don't understand. Why us?
Posts.Title: Anyone NEED Xeloda? K-Lo themodeldoctor
